September is Suicide Prevention Month and World Suicide Prevention Day 2020 is observed on September 10 each year to promote worldwide action to prevent suicides.

Unfortunately due to Covid-19 (social distancing), the county will not be holding it’s annual Suicide Prevention and Awareness Walk this year, but you are invited to drive by the Human Services bldg. at 795 Woodlane Road in Westampton between the hours of 10am – 5pm to visit our Pinwheel Garden located out front of the bldg.

If you are in crisis, please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255 or contact the Crisis Text Line by texting TALK to 741741

No Place for Hate Update: Following the great news that our schools received designation as a No Place for Hate School by the ADL, we wanted to share with you some of the activities we did this year to ensure our school is #noplaceforhate.

In the fall, we rolled out this initiative to students; all students and faculty signed the No Place for Hate pledge!

In February, the middle school mixed up students' normal seats at lunch and had them work together on a STEM challenge. The focus of this activity was to get students out of their comfort zones to meet new people, and we definitely succeeded!

We are excited to see what next year will bring to our school and how we can continue to promote inclusivity, diversity, and community. #noplaceforhate

NB Applied Tech & Engineering Department Supports Covid-19 PPE Fabrication

Ethan White and his classmates have organized an impressive 3D printing operation making components for face shields, ear-savers, and PAPRs (powered air purifying respirators). Mr. Potts, an Applied Technology teacher from Northern and two LulzBot 3D Printers joined the efforts recently. Ethan's 3D Cares Facebook page (@3DCaresnj) shows how our community is protecting the front line during this global pandemic. Raw material and financial donations have been received to keep the printers running all day and all night. In collaboration with SEWA International, local hospital healthcare workers are among those benefiting from this effort.

Dr. Robin McLean named National Association of Agricultural Educators Region VI Vice President

Last week, Middle School Agriculture Teacher, Dr. McLean attended the National Association of Agricultural Educators (NAAE) Convention held in conjunction with the Association for Career and Technical Education (ACTE) VISION19. While there, Dr. McLean attended several professional development workshops and also helped conduct NAAE business in her role as Region VI Secretary. She was elected to serve a three year term as the NAAE Region VI Vice President, a region serving 13 states from Maine to Virginia. She also was presented with the Region VI Teacher Mentor Award, an award designed to recognize individuals who have answered the call to mentor fellow agricultural educators, both pre-service teachers as well as other inservice teachers. Northern Burlington is proud of our teachers who actively engage in professional organizations and of Dr. McLean who represents us well in this national forum.

post_text: Students in Mrs. VanSciver's Honors World History classes are working hard to create exhibits and presentations featuring European absolute monarchs along with an evaluation of their rule. This collaborative research project focuses on the following questions: How did this ruler govern? What were the advantages and disadvantages of this leadership style? Why did the Age of Absolutism end? After researching, comparing findings, creating artifacts, and a making google slideshow, students will share their conclusions with fellow world historians. Students are enjoying this hands-on experience where they can investigate, reflect, and discover how the past truly drives the present!

Attention Northern Burlington parents and students! This year we are slowly migrating to online forms using our student management system, PowerSchool, via a plugin called ECollect. By the end of the year 2020, it is our goal to be completely online and paperless! We need your help! Both parents and students should have their own log in information for PowerSchool via the web and/or the phone app.

The first form now online is our Parent/Student Consent form. This form provides NB with critical information regarding the administration of medication, release of personal information, and consent regarding pictures. BOTH parent and student must login separately to PowerSchool to complete before final submission. If you have not done so already, please login to PowerSchool and on the left hand side select “Ecollect Forms” and under the tab “School Forms” click on the Parent/Student Consent Form. Attention Northern Burlington parents and students! This year we are slowly migrating to online forms using our student management system, PowerSchool, via a plugin called ECollect. By the end of the year 2020, it is our goal to be completely online and paperless! We need your help! Both parents and students should have their own log in information for PowerSchool via the web and/or the phone app.

The first form now online is our Parent/Student Consent form. This form provides NB with critical information regarding the administration of medication, release of personal information, and consent regarding pictures. BOTH parent and student must login separately to PowerSchool to complete before final submission. If you have not done so already, please login to PowerSchool and on the left hand side select “Ecollect Forms” and under the tab “School Forms” click on the Parent/Student Consent Form. Please be sure to hit submit and thank you in advance for your help and cooperation!
